name: Corinthian
body:
### Welcome
Not unlike rich Corinthian Leather the Corinthian project aims to provide more advanced UI elements for applications built with Apache Cordova. Initially Cordova will target the Android platform but as time goes own we'll add support for other platforms. 

### Philosophy
We think Apache Cordova is great but there are some things that it doesn't address as they are outside of it's bailiwick. One of those items is a rich UI. Sometimes building Apache Cordova applications is more difficult than it could be as it doesn't (nor shouldn't) provide UI components. The philosophy of the Corinthian project is to provide some of these UI components like contact and file pickers as well as we'll monkey punch the <audio/> and <video/> tags so you won't have to change your HTML code when porting you application to Android.
 
### Future Plans
Right now the target is Android but over time we'll migrate these native Android UI components into JavaScript so that it will be compatible with other platforms. 

### Installation
TBD

### Contributing
Clone the git repository for the project.
Send a pull request on GitHub with your changes.

### Authors and Contributors
Simon MacDonald (@macdonst) - Project creator
tagline: Provide some common UI elements to Apache Cordova applications.
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
